summary: This document is an email exchange between two individuals (likely federal prosecutors or law enforcement officials) discussing the assignment of a team to investigate Jeffrey Epstein's death. One person volunteers to participate in the investigation if needed.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.role: Federal Prosecutor or Law Enforcement Official
persons.context: The sender of the original email, who volunteers to participate in the investigation into Epstein's death if a different team is being assigned.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.role: Federal Prosecutor or Law Enforcement Official
persons.context: The recipient who responds, acknowledging the volunteer and stating they've asked someone else to take the lead for now, but will keep the volunteer in mind.

connections.description: Colleagues within the same office (likely US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) discussing team assignment for an investigation.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein Death Investigation Team
events.description: Email exchange regarding the assignment of a team to investigate Jeffrey Epstein's death, with one official volunteering to participate.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: The death of Jeffrey Epstein, which is the subject of the planned investigation discussed in the emails.

keyFacts: The email exchange occurred on August 11, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
A team was being assigned to investigate Epstein's death, with one individual asked to take the lead.
Another individual volunteered to participate in the investigation if the team needed to be expanded.
